definitions: all plant and animal life in a particular habitat or region
examples: The desert biota has adapted to extreme conditions
Scientists study the marine biota of coral reefs

definitions: shortened form of biotechnology referring to the commercial industry
examples: She invested heavily in biotech companies last year
The biotech sector is developing new cancer treatments

definitions: use of living organisms or biological systems to develop products and technologies
examples: Biotechnology has revolutionized medicine through genetic engineering
The company specializes in agricultural biotechnology for crops

definitions: intentional release of harmful biological agents like bacteria or viruses to cause fear or illness
examples: The government increased funding for bioterrorism defense measures
Experts trained hospital staff to recognize bioterrorism attacks

definitions: airplane with two sets of wings stacked one above the other
examples: The vintage biplane performed aerobatic stunts at the airshow
Early aviation pioneers flew biplanes across the Atlantic

definitions: deciduous tree with distinctive white or silver bark and triangular leaves
bundle of birch twigs used historically for corporal punishment
examples: The white birch trees created a beautiful forest canopy
Native Americans used birch bark to make canoes
The schoolmaster kept a birch behind his desk
Corporal punishment with the birch was common centuries ago

definitions: structure made of wire or bars designed to keep pet birds confined
examples: She covered the birdcage at night for quiet
The antique birdcage hung empty as decoration

definitions: score of one stroke under par on a golf hole
affectionate or informal term for a small bird
examples: He made a birdie on the difficult seventh hole
The crowd cheered when she sank the birdie putt
Look at that little birdie on the fence post
The children fed breadcrumbs to the birdies

definitions: musical sounds and calls produced by birds especially in morning or mating season
examples: The morning birdsong woke us at dawn peacefully
She recorded the birdsong for her nature documentary

definitions: act or process of delivering a baby from the womb
examples: The birthing center offers natural delivery options for mothers
She attended birthing classes to prepare for labor

definitions: colored mark on skin that is present from birth or appears shortly after
examples: The baby had a small birthmark on her shoulder
His distinctive birthmark made him easily recognizable

definitions: place where someone was born or something originated
examples: She visited her birthplace in Ireland last summer
Memphis is considered the birthplace of rock and roll

definitions: right or privilege that belongs to someone from birth especially as eldest child
examples: He claimed the throne as his birthright
Freedom of speech is every citizen's birthright

definitions: South Asian mixed rice dish with meat, vegetables, and aromatic spices
examples: The restaurant serves authentic chicken biryani every Friday
She learned to make vegetable biryani from her grandmother

definitions: small round bread leavened with baking powder commonly eaten with meals
sweet baked good similar to a cookie in British usage
examples: She served warm biscuits with honey and butter
The fluffy biscuits complemented the fried chicken perfectly
Would you like a chocolate biscuit with your tea
The tin contained assorted biscuits for afternoon snacks

definitions: person who is romantically or sexually attracted to both men and women
examples: She came out as bisexual to her family last year
The support group welcomes bisexual individuals and allies

definitions: romantic or sexual attraction to both men and women as an orientation
examples: Bisexuality is often misunderstood by people unfamiliar with it
The book explores bisexuality throughout history and cultures

definitions: district under a bishop's control or the office and authority of a bishop
examples: The bishopric covered three counties in medieval times
He was appointed to the bishopric after years of service

definitions: brittle metallic element with pinkish tinge used in medicine and cosmetics
examples: Bismuth compounds are used to treat stomach upset
The crystal displayed beautiful bismuth formations with rainbow colors

definitions: large shaggy-haired wild ox native to North America and Europe
examples: The bison herd grazed peacefully on the open plains
Native Americans depended on bison for food and materials

definitions: small restaurant serving simple meals in a modest setting
examples: They met for lunch at the corner bistro
The French bistro offered authentic cuisine and wine

definitions: computer graphics image stored as a grid of individual pixels
examples: The designer converted the bitmap image to vector format
Bitmap files can become very large at high resolutions

definitions: feeling or experience combining happiness with sadness or pleasure with pain
woody climbing plant with orange berries used in decorations
examples: Graduation was a bittersweet moment for the parents
Their reunion after years apart felt bittersweet
She gathered bittersweet vines for the autumn wreath
The bittersweet berries attracted birds to the garden

definitions: aquatic mollusk with hinged double shell such as clams oysters or mussels
examples: The restaurant specializes in fresh bivalve dishes daily
Scientists studied how bivalves filter ocean water

definitions: temporary camp without tents or with minimal shelter used especially by soldiers or mountaineers
examples: The soldiers set up a bivouac for the night
Climbers established a bivouac on the mountain ledge

definitions: magazine or newspaper published once every two weeks
examples: The company newsletter is a biweekly publication
She subscribes to several biweekly industry magazines

definitions: informal shortened form of the word business
examples: He's been in show biz for twenty years
The tech biz is constantly changing and evolving

definitions: person who talks too much and cannot keep secrets
examples: Don't tell Sarah, she's such a blabbermouth
The office blabbermouth spread the news within hours

definitions: dark purple berry growing on thorny bushes used in jams and desserts
brand of smartphone popular in early 2000s with physical keyboard
examples: We picked wild blackberries along the hiking trail
The blackberry pie won first prize at the fair
She typed emails quickly on her Blackberry device
The company issued Blackberry phones to all executives

definitions: medium-sized songbird with black plumage found in gardens and woodlands
examples: A blackbird sang from the apple tree branch
The male blackbird has a bright yellow beak

definitions: dark surface usually made of slate used for writing with chalk in classrooms
examples: The teacher wrote equations on the blackboard
Students took turns solving problems at the blackboard

definitions: dark makeup worn by performers to represent black people in offensive and racist manner
examples: The museum exhibit explained the harmful history of blackface
Universities banned blackface from all campus events

definitions: card game where players try to get cards totaling twenty-one
short leather-covered club loaded with lead used as weapon
examples: She won big playing blackjack in Las Vegas
The dealer explained the blackjack rules to newcomers
Police found a blackjack during the weapon search
The suspect carried an illegal blackjack for protection

definitions: list of people or things considered unacceptable or untrustworthy and excluded from privileges
examples: The company maintained a blacklist of problem suppliers
During McCarthyism, many actors were put on blacklists

definitions: practice of demanding money or favors by threatening to reveal embarrassing information
examples: The politician fell victim to blackmail over photos
She reported the blackmail attempt to the police immediately

definitions: person who practices blackmail by threatening to expose secrets for gain
examples: The blackmailer demanded money to stay quiet
Police arrested the blackmailer after a sting operation

definitions: failure of electrical power supply over a wide area
temporary loss of consciousness or memory
examples: The summer blackout affected millions of residents
Candles sold out during the three-day blackout
He suffered a blackout after drinking too much
The witness had a blackout and couldn't remember details

definitions: person who makes and repairs things from iron by heating and hammering
examples: The village blacksmith shoed horses and made tools
Modern blacksmiths create decorative ironwork for homes

definitions: thorny shrub with white flowers and dark purple fruit used to make sloe gin
examples: The blackthorn hedge bloomed with white flowers in spring
He cut a walking stick from seasoned blackthorn wood

definitions: sac-like organ that collects and stores urine before elimination from body
examples: The doctor examined her bladder for signs of infection
Drinking water helps maintain a healthy bladder

definitions: boring or meaningless talk or writing that lacks substance
examples: The meeting was just corporate blah about synergy
She skipped through all the blah in the report

definitions: skillful flattery or coaxing talk often associated with Irish charm
examples: His blarney convinced her to give him another chance
Don't believe his blarney about being a millionaire

definitions: act of speaking sacrilegiously about sacred things or showing contempt for religion
examples: The author was accused of blasphemy by religious leaders
Medieval laws punished blasphemy with severe penalties

definitions: device that uses explosives or compressed air for demolition or cleaning
futuristic ray gun or energy weapon in science fiction
examples: The construction crew used a rock blaster for excavation
Workers wore protection when operating the sand blaster
The space hero drew his laser blaster quickly
Kids played with toy blasters in the backyard

definitions: film genre from 1970s that exploited stereotypes of black people for entertainment aimed at urban audiences
examples: Film scholars study blaxploitation movies as cultural artifacts
The documentary examined the blaxploitation era's impact on cinema

definitions: intensely burning fire producing bright flames and heat
white stripe or mark on an animal's face especially horses
examples: Firefighters battled the blaze for several hours
The blaze destroyed three buildings before being controlled
The horse had a distinctive white blaze down its face
She chose the pony with the star-shaped blaze
